articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Mexico's president says will ask for planned gas pipeline to be rerouted
articles.description: Mexico's President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said that he will ask for a natural gas pipeline being developed by Canada's TC Energy Corp to be rerouted so it does not cut across lands considered sacred by communities in Puebla state.
articles.content: MEXICO CITY, Jan 4 (Reuters) - Mexico’s President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said that he will ask for a natural gas pipeline being developed by Canada’s TC Energy Corp to be rerouted so it does not cut across lands considered sacred by communities in Puebla… [+878 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Body of Iranian military commander killed in Iraq in U.S. military strike returned to Iran
articles.description: The body of Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in Iraq in a U.S. military strike, was returned to Iran on Sunday, the official IRIB news agency reported.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - The body of Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in Iraq in a U.S. military strike, was returned to Iran on Sunday, the official IRIB news agency reported. 
Soleimani’s body was flown to the city of Ahvaz in southwest… [+1052 chars]

articles.description: The body of Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in Iraq in a U.S. military strike, was returned to Iran on Sunday, the official IRIB news agency reported.
articles.content:
GENEVA (Reuters) - The body of Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, who was killed in Iraq in a U.S. military strike, was returned to Iran on Sunday, the official IRIB news agency reported.

articles.title: Japan orders tightening of immigration procedures after Ghosn flees country-statement
articles.description: Japan's Justice Minister Masako Mori said on Sunday the ministry has ordered tightening of immigration procedures in the wake of the escape of ousted Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn.
articles.content:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan’s Justice Minister Masako Mori said on Sunday the ministry has ordered tightening of immigration procedures in the wake of the escape of ousted Nissan Motor Co boss Carlos Ghosn.

articles.author: Keith Zhai
articles.title: China replaces head of Hong Kong liaison office amid ongoing protests
articles.description: China has replaced the head of its Hong Kong Liaison Office, the most senior mainland political official based in the Chinese-controlled territory, following more than six months of often-violent anti-government protests in the city.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE (Reuters) - China has replaced the head of its Hong Kong Liaison Office, the most senior mainland political official based in the Chinese-controlled territory, following more than six months of often-violent anti-government protests in the city.

articles.title: NBA notebook: Contact with ref costs Wizards’ Thomas $25K
articles.description: The NBA has fined Washington Wizards guard Isaiah Thomas $25,000 for making inappropriate physical contact with an official, the league announced Saturday.

articles.title: Djokovic concerned about smoke at Australian Open as bushfires continue to blaze
articles.description: Tennis world number two Novak Djokovic said he is concerned that smoke might cause some problems at the Australian Open later this month as bushfires continued to blaze across large sections of the southeast on Sunday.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Tennis world number two Novak Djokovic said he is concerned that smoke might cause some problems at the Australian Open later this month as bushfires continued to blaze across large sections of the southeast on Sunday.

articles.title: China's central bank says will keep monetary policy prudent, flexible and appropriate
articles.description: China will keep monetary policy prudent, flexible and appropriate, and continue to deepen financial reforms, the central bank said on Sunday, reiterating previous policy statements.'
articles.content:
BEIJING (Reuters) - China will keep monetary policy prudent, flexible and appropriate, and continue to deepen financial reforms, the central bank said on Sunday, reiterating previous policy statements.
